Lack of engagement: Students may struggle to stay motivated and engaged with course material, leading to low completion rates.
Quality control: Ensuring that the course content is of high quality and meets the needs of students can be a challenge, particularly if the instructor lacks experience in online teaching.
Accessibility: Making the course accessible to students with disabilities can be a challenge, particularly if the course relies heavily on visual or auditory content.
Assessment: Designing effective assessments that accurately measure student learning can be difficult, particularly in an online environment.
Student feedback: Gathering and incorporating student feedback can be challenging, particularly if students are not actively engaged with the course.
